concept.title: XHTML processing modules
concept.shortdesc: The DITA-OT ships with several varieties of XHTML output, each of which follows roughly the same path through the processing pipeline. All XHTML-based transformation begin with the same call to the preprocess module, after which they generate XHTML files and then branch to create the transformation-specific navigation files.

section.draft-comment: Does the content in this section pertain to the dita.map.xhtml target?
section.p: After the pre-processing operation runs, XHTML-based builds each run a common series of Ant targets. Navigation may be created before or after this set of common routines.

ul.li: When the arg.css parameter is passed to the build to add a CSS file, the copy-css target copies the CSS file from its source location to the relative location in the output directory.
When a DITAVAL file is used, the copy-revflag target copies the default start- and end-revision flags into the output directory.

The dita.inner.topics.xhtml and dita.outer.topics.xhtml targets are used to convert DITA topics into XHTML files. After the pre-processing is completed, each DITA topic in the temporary directory corresponds to one XHTML file. Thedita.inner.topics.xhtml target is used to process documents that are in the map directory (or subdirectories of the map directory). The dita.outer.topics.xhtml target is used to process documents that are outside of the scope of the map, and thus might end up outside of the designated output directory. Various DITA-OT parameters control how documents processed by the dita.outer.topics.xhtml target are handled.
